sense.name: make a ticking sound
sense.examples: The clock ticked quietly in the corner. That package is ticking! Call the bomb squad!

sense.name: check off; enumerate or keep track of
sense.commentary: Includes: TICK OFF, TICK AWAY Syntax includes: NP1 TICK (off) NP2 NP1 TICK (away) NP2
sense.examples: I always have to stop and tick off the words on my fingers. Why don't we make a list and tick off the items as we finish them? Get in the cab--the meter is already ticking up the fare. The clock is ticking away the seconds until we can leave. Maybe she ticked the "unsuitable parent" box.

sense.name: make angry
sense.examples: She really ticked me off with that comment about my dirty windows. Boy, did he tick off the wrong person!

sense.name: run, function
sense.examples: The vehicle appeared to be generally in good condition, and the engine was ticking over fine. While the restaurant was ticking over nicely, the downstairs wine bar was empty. I wonder what makes him tick.
